title: AVX Bitwise ternary logic instruction busted
dot:
digraph SIMD_AVX_Amiga{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];Audience[label="Audience
- SIMD CPU Programmers
- Veteran Amiga Programmers" shape=ellipse]; AVX_Instruction[label="AVX Instruction: vpternlogd
- Bitwise ternary logic
- 3 input sources (A, B, C)
- 512-bit registers
- Flexible 8-bit immediate value (#imm8)" shape=box]; Amiga_Blitter[label="Amiga Blitter
- Custom chip for graphics
- Move bitmap graphics
- Logical operations with 3 bitmap sources
- 8-bit minterm value" shape=box]; Calculation_Method[label="Calculation Method for Minterm
- Treat #imm8 as a lookup table
- Example: 1 when exactly 2 inputs are 1
- Fill truth table and read bits bottom to up" shape=box]; Common_Minterm[label="Common Minterm Value: 0xE2
- Used for masked sprites
- Logic: If mask (B) is set, use sprite (A); else use background (C)" shape=box]; Conclusion[label="Conclusion
- Retro influence in modern instructions
- Connection between AVX and Amiga" shape=box];Audience->AVX_Instruction;Audience->Amiga_Blitter; AVX_Instruction->Calculation_Method;Amiga_Blitter->Calculation_Method; Calculation_Method->Common_Minterm; Common_Minterm->Conclusion;}
